text: Dolores del Río (August 3, 1904 – April 11, 1983, birth name María de los Dolores Asúnsolo y López Negrete) was a Mexican movie actress. She was a Hollywood movie star in the 1920s and 1930s. She was important to the Golden Age of Mexican Cinema during the 1940s and 1950s. In the 1928 movie Ramona, Del Río played the title character. She also played the title character in Evangeline (1929). She played Madame du Barry in the motion picture of that name. Del Río was born in Durango, Mexico. She died in Newport Beach, California at 77 of liver disease. ==References== == Other websites == * Category:Disease-related deaths in the United States Category:Mexican movie actors Category:Radio actors Category:1904 births Category:1983 deaths Category:People from Durango
title: Dolores del Río
